trans-unit.target: Paramètres communs

trans-unit.source: Cross-domain tracking
trans-unit.target: Suivi multi-domaines

trans-unit.target: Suivi des liens externes et courriels

trans-unit.target: Suivi des liens sur fichiers

trans-unit.source: Google Analytics tracking
trans-unit.target: Statistiques Google Analytics

trans-unit.source: Files & directories
trans-unit.target: Files & directories

trans-unit.source: Enhanced link attribution
Path to template root (FE):You can alter this in case you want to customize the tracking code output
trans-unit.target: Path to template root (FE):You can alter this in case you want to customize the tracking code output

trans-unit.source: Path to template partials (FE):You can alter this, though the standard plugin doesn't use partials ...
trans-unit.target: Path to template partials (FE):You can alter this, though the standard plugin doesn't use partials ...

trans-unit.source: Path to template layouts (FE):You can alter this, though the standard plugin doesn't use layouts ...
trans-unit.target: Path to template layouts (FE):You can alter this, though the standard plugin doesn't use layouts ...

trans-unit.source: Enable Google Analytics Tracking:This has to be enabled for tracking your website with Universal Analytics
trans-unit.target: Enable Google Analytics Tracking:This has to be enabled for tracking your website with Universal Analytics

trans-unit.source: Google Analytics "Web Property-ID":The "Web Property-ID" is issued by Google Analytics and uniquely identifies your website. It should have the format UA-XXXXX-X and can be found in the "Admin > Account Administration" section of your Google Analytics interface
trans-unit.target: Google Analytics "Web Property-ID":The "Web Property-ID" is issued by Google Analytics and uniquely identifies your website. It should have the format UA-XXXXX-X and can be found in the "Admin > Account Administration" section of your Google Analytics interface

trans-unit.source: Done!
Debug mode:Enable the debug mode in order to get detailed output to your javascript console (deactivate for production use)
trans-unit.target: Debug mode:Enable the debug mode in order to get detailed output to your javascript console (deactivate for production use)

trans-unit.source: Remarketing & advertising:Enable Remarketing and Advertising Reporting Features to see data in the demographics and interest reports
Anonymize IP address:Activate this feature for anonymizing your visiors' IP addresses (e.g. required by german law)
trans-unit.target: Anonymize IP address:Activate this feature for anonymizing your visiors' IP addresses (e.g. required by german law)

trans-unit.source: Remove empty custom dimensions
Track page title:You might want to disable this feature if you have no specified or very long and cryptic page titles
trans-unit.target: Track page title:You might want to disable this feature if you have no specified or very long and cryptic page titles

trans-unit.source: Track client info:Disable this if you do not want to track your visitors' browser types / versions
trans-unit.target: Track client info:Disable this if you do not want to track your visitors' browser types / versions

trans-unit.source: Track flash version:Disable this if you do not want to track your visitors' flash plugin types / versions
trans-unit.target: Track flash version:Disable this if you do not want to track your visitors' flash plugin types / versions

trans-unit.source: Tracking across sub-domains:If you want to enable tracking across multiple sub-domains, set this to "Manual" and enter the main domain name for all the sub-domains you want to track (see next setting "domain.main"). Set this to "None" in order to ensure that the cookies in a given domain are not accessible by any sub-domains
trans-unit.target: Tracking across sub-domains:If you want to enable tracking across multiple sub-domains, set this to "Manual" and enter the main domain name for all the sub-domains you want to track (see next setting "domain.main"). Set this to "None" in order to ensure that the cookies in a given domain are not accessible by any sub-domains

trans-unit.source: Main domain name:If you've chosen "Manual" domain name entry above (setting "domain.sub"), please enter your main domain name here (it might be preceded by a dot in order to assure that *only* sub-domains will be tracked and the main domain itself be ommited)
trans-unit.target: Main domain name:If you've chosen "Manual" domain name entry above (setting "domain.sub"), please enter your main domain name here (it might be preceded by a dot in order to assure that *only* sub-domains will be tracked and the main domain itself be ommited)

trans-unit.source: Tracking across multiple domains:If you want to enable tracking across multiple (top level) domains, enter the domain names here (separated by a comma)
trans-unit.target: Tracking across multiple domains:If you want to enable tracking across multiple (top level) domains, enter the domain names here (separated by a comma)

trans-unit.source: Track external URLs:Choose whether and how traversals to external website URLs should be tracked
trans-unit.target: Track external URLs:Choose whether and how traversals to external website URLs should be tracked

trans-unit.source: External URL prefix / category:Enter the prefix (tracking as pageView) respectively the event category (tracking as event) that should be used for external URLs
trans-unit.target: External URL prefix / category:Enter the prefix (tracking as pageView) respectively the event category (tracking as event) that should be used for external URLs

trans-unit.source: Restrict to domains:Enter a comma separated list of domains if you would like to restrict tracking to those ones
trans-unit.target: Restrict to domains:Enter a comma separated list of domains if you would like to restrict tracking to those ones

trans-unit.source: Track e-mail links:Choose whether and how e-mail links should be tracked
trans-unit.target: Track e-mail links:Choose whether and how e-mail links should be tracked

trans-unit.source: E-mail link prefix / category:Enter the prefix (tracking as pageView) respectively the event category (tracking as event) that should be used for e-mail links
trans-unit.target: E-mail link prefix / category:Enter the prefix (tracking as pageView) respectively the event category (tracking as event) that should be used for e-mail links

trans-unit.source: Restrict to e-mail addresses:Enter a comma separated list of e-mail addresses if you would like to restrict tracking to those ones
trans-unit.target: Restrict to e-mail addresses:Enter a comma separated list of e-mail addresses if you would like to restrict tracking to those ones

trans-unit.source: Track downloads:Choose whether and how file downloads should be tracked
trans-unit.target: Track downloads:Choose whether and how file downloads should be tracked

trans-unit.source: Download link prefix / category:Enter the prefix (tracking as pageView) respectively the event category (tracking as event) that should be used for download links
trans-unit.target: Download link prefix / category:Enter the prefix (tracking as pageView) respectively the event category (tracking as event) that should be used for download links

trans-unit.source: Download link template:Enter the tracking template string used for should be used for download links (see manual for details)
trans-unit.target: Download link template:Enter the tracking template string used for should be used for download links (see manual for details)

trans-unit.source: Download folders & extensions:Enter the folders and file extensions that should be tracked. You may provide a comma separated list of directory-extensions-combinations like this: /path/to/folder=pdf doc zip, /path/to/another/folder=zip rar exe
trans-unit.target: Download folders & extensions:Enter the folders and file extensions that should be tracked. You may provide a comma separated list of directory-extensions-combinations like this: /path/to/folder=pdf doc zip, /path/to/another/folder=zip rar exe

trans-unit.source: Direct traffic keywords:Enter a comma separated list of keywords which – if used as search terms by your visitors - should be registered as direct traffic (instead of organic / search engine traffic). It is common to enter one's domain here ...
trans-unit.target: Direct traffic keywords:Enter a comma separated list of keywords which – if used as search terms by your visitors - should be registered as direct traffic (instead of organic / search engine traffic). It is common to enter one's domain here ...

trans-unit.source: Direct traffic referrer:Enter a comma separated list of domains which should be treated as direct traffic sources (instead of external referrers). You could e.g. enter secondary domains you use
trans-unit.target: Direct traffic referrer:Enter a comma separated list of domains which should be treated as direct traffic sources (instead of external referrers). You could e.g. enter secondary domains you use

trans-unit.source: Search engine traffic sources:Enter a comma separated list of search engine / keyword name definitions that should be considered as search engine traffic sources (e.g. "MySpecialSearchEngine=query, AnotherSE=search"). If you want a search engine to be prepended to the list of known traffic sources, append an exclamation mark to the definition (e.g. "MostImportantSearchEngine=q!")
trans-unit.target: Search engine traffic sources:Enter a comma separated list of search engine / keyword name definitions that should be considered as search engine traffic sources (e.g. "MySpecialSearchEngine=query, AnotherSE=search"). If you want a search engine to be prepended to the list of known traffic sources, append an exclamation mark to the definition (e.g. "MostImportantSearchEngine=q!")

trans-unit.source: Use enhanced link attribution
Link attribution cookie name
Link attribution cookie lifetime in seconds
Max. parent levels to look for a unique ID
